message: I've just updated my Slackware system, and have installed my colorschemes (wombat variants). I notice that the colorscheme doesn't engage on some files, and somehow changes (deepens, I think) only after an initial keystroke (e.g., j, k, etc.). Does this make sense? Is there some framebuffer setting I need to check?

What terminal emulator are you using?
Can you link to your .vimrc file? Perhaps the error is there.

I'm using xterm in Xorg 7.6. Don't have a link to my .vimrc yet, but the only color-related items I have in there are "colorscheme" and a "highlight" command for comments. Everything else is user credentials, tab/number formatting, or keymaps. Removing the highlight instruction doesn't change anything.

very odd. You can also try posting this question @ http://groups.google.com/group/vim_use

Also, if you have a dropbox dir, you can put a copy of your vimrc in the 'public' folder and and get a public link for it (and post it here).

Posting your .vimrc to github is also good option, here's mine: https://github.com/oryband/dotvim
